intro: Gutierrezia mandonii, commonly known as sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as sandy soils and rocky slopes. Its yellow flowers bloom in the summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Gutierrezia mandonii is also known for its ability to thrive in harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in desert ecosystems.
